title: Riot's Reasoning for PD Changes is Downright Laughable

replies.body:
Let's not compare magic pen to armor pen. Magic pen is far far stronger then armor pen, which is why its significantly harder to build.

Why is magic pen stronger? Look at base stats.

Ranged champions tend to get significantly higher armor per level, as compared to MR per level. A few seasons ago, they didn't even get any MR per level.

If magic pen was made as easy to buy as armor pen, we would see mages doing true damage to every ranged champion that doesn't have an MR item.

building PD still makes them lose damage btw, lower Attack speed, no energise passive or AOE crits.

Im okay with it, pd gives a shield? What do shields block? True damage.


What is true damage supposed to counter? Literally anyone who builds resistances.

Adcs SHOULD have an easily accessible counter to true damage, even if its limited.

Especially considering most true damage dealers apply true damage consistently (vayne and yi) or use their true damage to execute (darius and cho and I guess vel and camille)


When do we use ignite most of the time? When you intend to finish off the enemy. (I guess there are a few instances where you just don't want them healing

Even if its just 2 seconds its very likely the pd user`s shield would block true damage despite needing to be so low for it to proc.

A lot more fair than the pd user getting constant damage reduction as if they were supposed to be a tank.





The only potential problem I can think of this causing is a champ like {{champion:240}} building crit now that crit is better earlier and pd can consistently give him a better chance at remounting.

Shields kinda block every single form of damage, lul. It's not just true damage, not at all.

Also, all Lifeline passives primarily exist to negate burst, which is the only way you stop an ADC from melting every single person with right clicks. What Riot did is basically letting ADCs build {{item:3053}} again, except with even better stats. There's no longer any repercussions for ADCs building to survive, and that's just completely bullshit. If you've ever played a mage or assassin, you know how much a {{item:3157}} /{{item:3156}} as second item hurts your damage. With this new PD, ADCs don't have to worry about that ever again.

Sterak`s scales to give a much stronger shield, gives tenacity, and lasts longer, not to mention you don't need to be near death for it to proc in which case you would already likely have taken the entire burst from the enemy team as a tankier champ.


Yes, ofc shields block every single form of damage, but not damage reduction from phantom dancer, that doesn't block true damage, you clearly didn't read that part? Its a change that leads to adcs having a way to mitigate it, even if it isn't reliable (which is actually is if you read)


Infact I don't think you read anything about how most true damage users apply true damage consistently / using that true damage as an execute, meaning the shield is very likely to block true damage since it procs when low hp -.-  But ill let your ignorance slide, lul.


As a tank player I feel very good about true damage users finally having a semi-reliable slap on the wrist when fighting champions who are on the squishy side of the spectrum, now they pay for their shredding ability, even if its just a little and not entirely reliable.

Honestly though, you mention true damage champs. But while I agree some lack more intuitive counterplay like to and vayne (besides cc and burst down), champs like Darius already have tons of counterplay and are meant to be rewarded for A) reaching oppoenents B) keeping them in range and C) surviving long enough to burst down an opponent with a true damage nuke AFTER meeting the other conditions. Darius is slow, no Shields, no resistance buffs, lowest AS in game, telegraphed Q, slight delay on E, and has to build 5 stacks. I think he should be rewarded anytime he uses his strengths properly to get an adc (many of whom can kite him for days down to  executable range. Imagine kaisai now with double Shields. That being said the AS was nerfed, they lost the %damage reduction, and maybe even had the crit nerfed, I don't remember. I think the new PD isn't unfair to fight overall, but it may disproportionately affect champs like Darius who will get punished for playing well

I agree that this is something to worry about for certain champs, true damage dealers in general being punished slightly was just something I was pointing out.

Maybe having {{item:3143}} and {{item:3075}} able to be bought together with no wasted gold on unique passives would be a good way to help darius deal with adcs (since darius players tend to build tanky anyway.)


Also an adc at 30% hp for pd to proc just might be low enough for darius ult to kill them considering his ult can do upwards of 1k damage and the shield can block up to 600 so hopefully darius can shrug this one off. If the ult doesn't kill them, the bleed almost certainly will.

Afterall, adcs no longer have to deal with wasting gold going over the crit cap, why should tanky champs need to suffer wasted gold aswell still.

I think I could be ok with that solution. I've long languished over the redundancy of randuins and thornmail, and I wouldn't mind a little more  durability in exchange for adcs being able to survive instaburst a little better. Also, I just realized, you may be right, but also, Darius can dunk most adcs from above 30% HP at 5 stacks (30% is when it prices correct?) Which means he can dunk them straight up in certain scenarios without even pricing the shield, kind of like blitz's passive.
FYI there was no defensive item outside of GA for ADCs. Now they finally have one.

I agree. They did nerf other aspects of PD and riot did mention that this crit rework iteration is meant to bring adcs online sooner, but give them less fullbuild power

I have mixed feelings about this post. 

I HATE the Phantom Dancer changes because this item has literally been a dualist item since season 1 back when PD and Ninja Tabi's were the two main sources of Dodge chance and it is very obviously not in any way, shape, or form a dualist item anymore: and it hurts all the champions who had formerly relied on it (In example Yasuo, Tynd, Lucian when he goes crit, Ashe, Draven, Kalista, Vayne, Kindred, etc). 

After this it's not like ADC's are the best class in the game anymore. They're probably the 4th or 5th best class in the game so they can use the help. But this isn't even that helpful to ADC's. It's legitimately the worst crit item in the game. Basically the only reason you buy this item is if the enemy team has an assassin or other kind of burst or hard engage champion: and even then it doesn't feel good. This item considerably lowers you DPS and the shield isn't even that good until late game.
Every assassin item has some defensive utility already. :/ and mages have items that give defensive utility.
